intro: Lachenalia pustulata, commonly known as the bulbous lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous stems and fleshy leaves. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, tubular flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Lachenalia pustulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable conditions.
